title: Work, Energy and Power
explanation: Understanding work done by forces, different forms of energy, energy transformations, and the rate of doing work (power).
detailedNotes:
Work, energy, and power are interconnected concepts in physics.

WORK:
- Work = Force × Distance (in direction of force)
- W = F × d × cosθ (θ = angle between force and displacement)
- Unit: Joule (J) = N·m
- Work is done only when force causes displacement

ENERGY:
Capacity to do work. Types:

1. Kinetic Energy (KE):
- Energy of motion
- KE = ½mv²
- Depends on mass and velocity

2. Potential Energy (PE):
- Stored energy due to position
- Gravitational PE = mgh
- Elastic PE = ½kx² (for springs)

3. Mechanical Energy:
- ME = KE + PE
- Conserved in absence of friction

CONSERVATION OF ENERGY:
- Energy cannot be created or destroyed
- Only transformed from one form to another
- Total energy remains constant

POWER:
- Rate of doing work or transferring energy
- P = Work/Time = W/t
- P = Energy/Time = E/t
- Unit: Watt (W) = J/s
- Also: P = Fv (force × velocity)

EFFICIENCY:
- Efficiency = (Useful energy output / Total energy input) × 100%
- Always less than 100% (due to energy losses)

examples.title: Calculating Work Done
examples.content: A force of 50 N pushes a box 10 m across a floor. How much work is done?
examples.solution:
W = F × d
W = 50 N × 10 m
W = 500 J

500 Joules of work is done on the box.

examples.title: Kinetic Energy
examples.content: Calculate the kinetic energy of a 2 kg object moving at 5 m/s.
examples.solution:
KE = ½mv²
KE = ½ × 2 kg × (5 m/s)²
KE = ½ × 2 × 25
KE = 25 J

The kinetic energy is 25 Joules.

exercises.question: A 10 kg mass is lifted to a height of 5 m. What is the potential energy gained? (g = 10 m/s²)
A machine does 600 J of work in 10 seconds. What is its power?

pastQuestions.question: The unit of power is:
pastQuestions.explanation: The SI unit of power is the Watt (W), which equals one Joule per second.
